page.title: 06MILTONDUFF DISTILLERY
page.content: The distillery is situated 5 km West of Elgin,Moray in the plain of Pluscarden,known as the Garden of Scotland and is famed for the growth of fine barley. The whole process of distilling takes place at Miltonduff Glenlivet.The malted barley is stored in the hoppers which can hold two lorry loads each of 40 tonnes.The malted barley is crushed in the grinding mills to produce the grist which is the malt after it has been ground.The grist is mixed in the mash tun with hot water.The liquids called worts from the mash tun are drained into the underback and then pumped to fermenters.In the fermenters yeast is added,ordinary white and brown which is the yeast left from beer making.After fermentation the liquid is called wash.
